member.name: IDropTarget.DragEnter
member.summary: Indicates whether a drop can be accepted, and, if so, the effect of the drop.
member.param: A pointer to the interface on the data object. This data object contains the data being transferred in the drag-and-drop operation. If the drop occurs, this data object will be incorporated into the target.

The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Possible values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.
On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The pdwEffect parameter is NULL on input.
There was insufficient memory available for this operation.

member.name: IDropTarget.DragLeave
member.summary: Removes target feedback and releases the data object.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible values include the following.

listheader.description: There is insufficient memory available for this operation.

member.name: IDropTarget.DragOver
member.summary: Provides target feedback to the user and communicates the drop's effect to the function so it can communicate the effect of the drop back to the source.
member.param: The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Valid values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.
On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The pdwEffect value is not valid.
There was insufficient memory available for this operation.

member.name: IDropTarget.Drop
member.summary: Incorporates the source data into the target window, removes target feedback, and releases the data object.
member.param: A pointer to the interface on the data object being transferred in the drag-and-drop operation.

The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Possible values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.
On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The pdwEffect parameter is not valid.
There is insufficient memory available for this operation.

member.name: IDropTarget
member.summary:
The IDropTarget interface is one of the interfaces you implement to provide drag-and-drop operations in your application. It contains methods used in any application that can be a target for data during a drag-and-drop operation. A drop-target application is responsible for:
Determining the effect of the drop on the target application.
Incorporating any valid dropped data when the drop occurs.
Communicating target feedback to the source so the source application can provide appropriate visual feedback such as setting the cursor.
Implementing drag scrolling.
Registering and revoking its application windows as drop targets.
The IDropTarget interface contains methods that handle all these responsibilities except registering and revoking the application window as a drop target, for which you must call the and the functions.
